title: U.S. Will Pay $1.6 Billion to Novavax for Coronavirus Vaccine
description: The federal government will pay the vaccine maker Novavax $1.6 billion to expedite the development of a coronavirus vaccine. Its the largest deal to date from Operation Warp Speed, the sprawling federal effort to make coronavirus vaccines and treatments available to the American public as quickly as possible.

title: Their Goal Is the End of America
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: In Hong Kong, a Proxy Battle Over Internet Freedom Begins
description: As Hong Kong grapples with a draconian new security law, the tiny territory is emerging as the front line in a global fight between the United States and China over censorship, surveillance and the future of the internet.

title: Britain looks to replace seasonal workers kept away by the virus.
description: Britons are in fields across the country doing something they probably would not have imagined a few months ago: working as farm laborers, picking berries.

title: A Bird? A Plane? No, Its a Google Balloon Beaming the Internet
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A fleet of high-altitude balloons started delivering internet service to Kenya on Tuesday, extending online access to tens of thousands of people in the first-ever commercial deployment of the technology.

title: Why Isnt the Southern Strategy Working?
description: The so-called Southern strategy  appealing to white voters by focusing on racial issues  has worked very well for the Republican Party. It has helped the party persuade many frustrated white working-class voters that the Democratic Party doesnt care about them.

title: Fauci Paints a Dire Picture
description: Trump taunts, Fauci frets and Biden finds some common ground with climate activists. Its Tuesday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: Follow the Money
description: Want this delivered to your inbox each morning? Sign up here.

title: New & Noteworthy, From Craigslist Confessions to Toxic Outrage
description: SEX AND LIES: True Stories of Womens Intimate Lives in the Arab World, by Leila Slimani. (Penguin, paper, $17.) Slimani, the French Moroccan novelist behind The Perfect Nanny and Adle, argues for a sexual revolution in the Arabic world to free women from the expectation that they must be wives or virgins.

title: Magic Leap Hires Top Microsoft Executive as C.E.O.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Magic Leap said on Tuesday that it had hired Peggy Johnson, a top executive at Microsoft, to be its chief executive, as the troubled augmented reality headset start-up shifts its focus from consumers to businesses.

title: Technology Bridges the Gap to Better Sight
description: This article is part of our continuing Fast Forward series, which examines technological, economic, social and cultural shifts that happen as businesses evolve.

title: London Police Stop Star Athletes, Setting Off Racial Profiling Debate
description: LONDON  The couple, a top British sprinter and a Portuguese track star, were driving their Mercedes through the elegant Maida Vale neighborhood in West London  their 3-month-old son in the back seat  when a police van appeared in their rearview mirror.

title: Los Angeles School District Cut Its Police Budget, Then the Chief Resigned
description: Good morning.

title: Patient Is Reported Free of H.I.V., but Scientists Urge Caution
description: A 36-year-old man in Brazil may be the first to experience long-term remission from H.I.V. after treatment with only a specially designed cocktail of antiviral drugs, researchers said on Tuesday.

title: A Shot to Protect Against H.I.V.
description: A single shot every two months prevents H.I.V. better than the most commonly used daily pill, Truvada, researchers reported on Tuesday.

title: Time Is Always Money: Pandemic Lockdowns Hasten Infrastructure Work
description: Sylvia Lamb, the assistant chief engineering officer for the Bay Area Rapid Transit system, started poring over the numbers in January. She and her colleagues were looking for answers to one key question: If the coronavirus hit California, what would that do to repairs and operations?

title: Deutsche Bank Settles Over Ignored Red Flags on Jeffrey Epstein
description: Payments to his alleged co-conspirators. Money wired to Russian models. A cash withdrawal of $100,000 for tips and household expenses.

title: The Sumptuous, Sour Music of Cory Smythe
description: Several years ago, I made a resolution: If I had the opportunity to hear Cory Smythe play piano, I would make it happen.

title: Hogan, Maryland Governor, Plans Book Tour as He Eyes 2024 White House Run
description: WASHINGTON  Gov. Larry Hogan of Maryland, a popular Republican governor who has drawn national attention for publicly challenging President Trump on the coronavirus, announced on Tuesday that he was starting a virtual book tour for his new memoir, elevating his profile as he considers a presidential run in 2024.

title: Two Chefs Moved to Rural Minnesota to Expand on Their Mission of Racial Justice
description: ST. JOSEPH, Minn.  Krewe, a restaurant in this small central-Minnesota city, is a tribute to Mary Mackbee, a former high school principal who raised four children in a Twin Cities suburb on the cooking of her native New Orleans.

title: Are Accessible Cosmetics the Final Frontier in Makeup Inclusivity?
description: In March 2010, Terri Bryant, a makeup artist and educator, began noticing slight changes to her skill set. Stiffness spanned from her left shoulder down to her fingers, which she was unable to move independently. By 2012, it was taking her a really long time to apply her clients makeup. At a wedding, she couldnt get the brides eyebrows to look balanced.

title: Ellie Goulding Likes Her 90s Rock Political and Her Social Media Inspiring
description: When Ellie Goulding finally finished promoting her 2015 album, Delirium, the exhausted British pop singer and songwriter took a step back to enjoy time at home. The break, tacked onto the long tail of Delirium, amounted to a five-year gap between LPs  an eternity for an in-demand artist, particularly one who delivered her first three records in roughly the same span.

title: Julianna Barwick Left Her Ghosts in New York. Then the Healing Began.
description: When Julianna Barwick began to cry while singing in bed, she knew she had found what shed wanted from California.

title: Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 2: On Vincent Lionti, Violist and Youth Orchestra Conductor, Dies at 60
description: Thank you to the 835 teenagers who participated in the second week of our 10-week Summer Reading Contest, and congratulations to Zachary Hommel, our winner, as well as to our many runners-up and honorable mentions.

title: Living In ... Island Heights, N.J.
description: Founded in the 19th century as a Methodist camp meeting site, this Ocean County borough retains an old-fashioned feeling, even as newcomers move in.

title: A Black-Owned Distillery in Minneapolis Pushes Forward
description: When Chris and Shanelle Montana founded Du Nord Craft Spirits in 2013, they chose the Longfellow neighborhood in southern Minneapolis, in part because it was a little quieter, Mr. Montana said.

title: The Song Says It All: Cover Your Freakin Face!
description: Randy Rainbow, the writer, performer and self-described Cuomosexual, is finally living in the apartment he always dreamed of.

title: Randy Rainbows (Upper) West Side Story
description: The YouTube star Randy Rainbow was 10 when his family relocated to South Florida from Commack, N.Y. For those who are fond of identifying silver linings, the unfortunate move furnished young Randy with a keen sense of purpose: getting back to New York as soon as possible.

title: In the Twin Cities Robust Dining Scene, Few Black-Owned Businesses
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Before the coronavirus decimated the restaurant industry, Minneapolis and St. Paul were being hailed around the country for their up-and-coming culinary scene.

title: Sweden Has Become the Worlds Cautionary Tale
description: LONDON  Ever since the coronavirus emerged in Europe, Sweden has captured international attention by conducting an unorthodox, open-air experiment. It has allowed the world to examine what happens in a pandemic when a government allows life to carry on largely unhindered.

title: Dogs May Be Good for Childrens Psychological Development
description: Living in a home with a dog may be linked to healthier psychological development in young children, researchers report.

title: For Cross-Border Couples, Plans to Reunite Are Still On Hold
description: When the border between the United States and Canada closed to nonessential travel on March 21 because of the coronavirus, Savannah Koop and Ryan Hamilton were less than two months away from the wedding they had been planning.

title: President Bolsonaro of Brazil Tests Positive for Coronavirus
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil, who has railed against social distancing measures and repeatedly downplayed the threat of the coronavirus as the epidemic in his country became the second-worst in the world, said Tuesday that he, too, had been infected.

title: Travel Restrictions on Americans Erode a Sense of Passport Privilege
description: LONDON  Five American travelers who set out for a getaway on Sardinia were turned away last week after their private jet landed on the Mediterranean island. In Canada, two Americans were fined for flouting tougher entry restrictions imposed by their northern neighbor.

title: We Went Inside a Houston Hospital Dealing With the Virus Surge
description: We spent time with the doctors and patients dealing with the outbreak at Houstons largest hospital. Ill be honest with you, I can barely keep track, one doctor told us.

title: Russia Arrests Space Agency Official, Accusing Him of Treason
description: MOSCOW  Russias secret police on Tuesday arrested a respected former reporter who worked in recent months as an adviser to the head of the countrys space agency, accusing him of treason for passing secrets to a NATO country.

title: Mary Trumps Book Accuses the President of Embracing Cheating as a Way of Life
description: Mary L. Trump, President Trumps niece, plans to publish a tell-all family memoir next week, describing how a decades long history of darkness, dysfunction and brutality turned her uncle into a reckless leader who, according to her publisher, Simon & Schuster, now threatens the worlds health, economic security and social fabric.

title: As November Looms, So Does the Most Litigious Election Ever
description: WASHINGTON  Four months before Election Day, a barrage of court rulings and lawsuits has turned one of the most divisive elections in memory into one that is on track to be the most litigated ever.

title: Professors Fears as the Fall Semester Approaches
description: To the Editor:

title: School of American Ballets Gutsy Kids: They Just Have to Dance
description: Its not your usual ballet recital.

title: Park Slope, Brooklyn, Gets a Beer Garden Built Into a Garage
description: Marina Charny, the owner of Wild, a gluten-free Italian restaurant, planned to use a former garage she acquired next to her Park Slope location as a party room. But then she had another idea: a beer hall. She kept one roll-up door, and, for now, this spot is open with outdoor seating at socially distant high-top tables for about a dozen drinkers. She and her partner in this venture, Oleg Kaziev, offer 13 local craft beers on tap, and theyll fill growlers. Wine, sangria and Prosecco are also poured. A raw bar and finger foods, like wings, fried calamari, guacamole, smoked ribs and pizza, are available. Once indoor dining is approved, there will be space for 50 at full capacity, about 25 well spaced.

title: Jaime Harrison and Amy McGrath Rake In Cash in Democratic Senate Bids
description: Democratic challengers in several key Senate races collected enormous hauls of cash in the second quarter of the year, the latest sign of the partys increasing strength as it tries to take control of the chamber in Novembers elections.

title: Womens British Open Will Proceed Without Fans
description: The Womens British Open will be held as planned, albeit without spectators, at Royal Troon Golf Club in Scotland from Aug. 20 to 23, the R&A, which conducts the tournament, said on Tuesday. The event will be the first womens major golf championship of 2020. Last month, another womens major, the Evian Championship, which had been scheduled for early August, was canceled for this year because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Killing of Security Analyst Seen as Message to Iraqi Government
description: BAGHDAD  The assassination of an outspoken Iraqi researcher who had antagonized the Islamic State as well as Iraqs Shiite militias was seen Tuesday as a message to the Iraqi government, but it was unclear who killed him.

title: Elizabeth Murray Estate Moves to Gladstone Gallery
description: Elizabeth Murray was represented by Pace Gallery for more than two decades. But now, almost 13 years after her death, her estate has chosen Gladstone Gallery to show and sell the pioneering Neo-Expressionist painters work. For Barbara Gladstone, the gallerys owner, including Murrays work in group shows with more contemporary artists to expand her audience is one of her top priorities. Bolstering Murrays international profile is another.

title: Internet Powers Collide in Hong Kong
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Trump, the Master of Distraction
description: To the Editor:

title: Richard di Liberto, Expert Photographer of Museum Art, Dies at 82
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: A Short History of Simp
description: The word simp isnt new. In fact, its pretty old.

title: Intense Arctic Wildfires Set a Pollution Record
description: Intense wildfires in the Arctic in June released more polluting gases into the Earths atmosphere than in any other month in 18 years of data collection, European scientists said in a report Tuesday.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $2 MILLION

title: They Cant Stomach Trump. Theyre Sufficiently Comfortable With Biden.
description: In Florida in 2016, J.C. Planas, a former Republican state representative, was uncomfortable with Hillary Clinton but detested Donald Trump, so he wrote in former Gov. Jeb Bush for president.

title: Can Anything Match Peaky Blinders?
description: Ive watched Peaky Blinders more times than I can count and have tried watching numerous other shows but nothing is as good. It has everything: the best writing, acting, cinematography, music  and Cillian Murphy. Can anything match it?  Arlene

title: DeSean Jackson Apologizes for Sharing Anti-Semitic Quotation
description: The star wide receiver DeSean Jackson apologized Tuesday for sharing an anti-Semitic quotation attributed to Hitler, after that and other social media posts were widely condemned, including by his team.

title: The Pandemics Economic Damage Is Growing
description: PARIS  It will take years for the global economy to recover from the jobs taken away by the pandemic, and in Europe the recession will be significantly deeper than forecast just two months ago.

title: Review: In Stateless on Netflix, Cate Blanchett (and Immigration)
description: Cate Blanchett was an executive producer as well as the star of Hulus Mrs. America, but the multi-Oscared actor actually made her debut as a television producer when the mini-series Stateless premiered in Australia in March. She also created the six-part drama, with the Australian writers Elise McCredie (a longtime friend) and Tony Ayres, and appears in a supporting role as a torch-singing hustler who runs a cultlike self-help racket out of her dance school.

title: When Washington Helped Small Business, Washington Was Helped
description: WASHINGTON  Car dealers and private schools, restaurants and doctors, hotels and contractors all got money from the program established to help small businesses survive the coronavirus. But a subset of the list of recipients reads like a guide to a professional political class that thrives in the nations capital no matter what is happening elsewhere in the country.

title: Everybody Dance Now: 20 Songs to Get the Party Started
description: It may be a while before dance floors are packed again. But music remains a priority for couples, even when hosting intimate socially distanced weddings and celebrations in person or via video conferencing apps and platforms. Hiring a D.J. for your reception  even a virtual one  offers several advantages.

title: Hoping for a Theater Bailout? Better Head to London
description: The last person youd expect to emerge as the theaters savior is Boris Johnson.

title: A Colossal Error: Mexican Leader Under Fire for Plan to Visit Trump
description: MEXICO CITY  The risks could be enormous, but they havent swayed President Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador of Mexico.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Huntsville Station
description: For these former inmates in Texas, the rush of emotions that accompany freedom play out at a Greyhound bus station.

title: The Surreal Moment After Release From Prison
description: When inmates are released from Huntsville Unit, the oldest state prison in Texas, the first destination for many is the nearby Greyhound bus station. Every weekday, the bus station becomes a site of reflection for men whove spent months, or decades, imprisoned. The short documentary above was filmed before the pandemic but captures the precarious period experienced by the estimated 600,000 people released annually from federal and state prisons across the country. With nothing much more than the clothes on their backs, a bus voucher and a $100 release check, these formerly incarcerated men grapple with the excitement and uncertainty that come with freedom.

title: Three Confederate Statues Removed in Richmond
description: Crews removed a statue of J.E.B. Stuart in Richmond, Va., the latest Confederate monument the city has taken down in recent days.

title: Ennio Morricone in Eight Moments
description: A composer who thought in terms of molten-guitar melodrama and wailing choral grandeur, Ennio Morricone, who died on Monday at 91, scored movies the way their biggest fans heard them in their heads. He believed in the films no matter how ridiculous, celebrating and amplifying their feelings into something transcendent. (Morricone was often more successful at doing this than their directors or screenwriters.)

title: Tiny Love Stories: She Wanted to Save the World
description: The night I met my best friend, Bhavya, we clashed over feminism and plastic surgery. I would go on to describe her as a more annoying version of myself. A year later, we argued about the apartment we would move into. We worked our way through medical school, and all the while, we argued: Medical specialties. Netflix shows. Politics. Ice cream. Men. Impostor syndrome. Despite the fights, she would always say, Stop underestimating yourself; youre brilliant. Someday, she will ask me, How did you meet him? But for now, let me tell how lucky I am to have met her.  Areej Ali

title: What Is Your True Character? And Whos to Judge It?
description: In the ungainly, interminable pageant of public apologies of late, one statement about misbehavior is proving strangely popular.

title: MacDowell Colony Drops the Word Colony, Citing Oppressive Overtones
description: The century-old artists retreat known as the MacDowell Colony is removing the word colony from its official name in response to a petition from staff members that pushed for the change, the organization said on Tuesday.

title: Family and Friends Mourn Killed Iraqi Analyst
description: The family of Hisham al-Hashimi, an outspoken Iraqi security analyst who was assassinated in front of his home, held a funeral for him in Baghdad on Tuesday.

title: Greyhound Review: At Sea in World War II, With Tom Hanks in Command
description: When the United States entered World War II in 1941, a huge challenge for its military was getting to where the fighting was, safely. Troops and equipment had to be moved over the water, even when protection from airborne forces was sporadic. In the Atlantic, this left Allied convoys vulnerable, for harrowingly long periods, to attack by the advanced German submarines known as U-boats.

title: With Pandemic Keeping Them Apart, Runners Embrace Virtual Races
description: On a Friday evening in late June, three women in matching blue-and-white Hoka running shoes leaned over a starting line at Buffalo Park in Flagstaff, Ariz., each with one hand on their watches.

title: Facebook Fails to Appease Organizers of Ad Boycott
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg, Facebooks two top executives, met with civil rights groups on Tuesday in an attempt to mollify them over how the social network treats hate speech on its site.

title: A Kennedy Wins N.J. Primary to Take on Trump Loyalist
description: In a rebuke of a potent New Jersey political machine, Amy Kennedy, a former schoolteacher whose husband is a nephew of President John F. Kennedy, won Tuesdays primary battle to take on Jeff Van Drew, a freshman congressman who defected from the Democrats with a pledge of loyalty to President Trump.

title: Mucho Mucho Amor Review: The Life of Walter Mercado, Mystic
description: The story that is told in the documentary Mucho Mucho Amor: The Legend of Walter Mercado is the familiar myth of a dreamer who finds tremendous fame, only to be pulled from the clouds by the sordid realities of life on the ground. If the film tends toward convention, it is saved from clich by the bejeweled and beguiling presence of Walter Mercado himself.

title: Live Analysis: New Jersey and Delaware Election Results
description: Follow live coverage and analysis from Times reporters.

title: Live: New Jersey State Primary Election Results 2020
description: Detailed results and maps from the New Jersey primary election.

Here Are Key Points About M.L.S.s Return
description: Major League Soccer is the first of North Americas major mens professional sports leagues to return, with a makeshift mini-tournament beginning on Wednesday night. Here are the hows, whys and wheres for the event, which is taking place in Florida, one of the countrys coronavirus hot spots. The caveat is that the leagues plans could easily change: In the last few days, a game has been postponed and a team has dropped out of the field.

title: W.H.O. Acknowledges Possibility of Airborne Transmission of Coronavirus
description: During a news briefing on Tuesday, W.H.O. officials said there was emerging evidence that the coronavirus can be transmitted by air.

title: New Data Sheds Light on Who Is Moving Because of the Pandemic
description: Last month, surveyors with the Pew Research Center set out to answer a timely question: Who is moving because of the pandemic, and why?

title: Consumer Bureau Scraps Restrictions on Payday Loans
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Tuesday formally rescinded a plan to impose new limits on payday lending, handing the industry a major victory by killing off tighter rules that it spent years lobbying to overturn.

title: Britain Says It Will Resume Arms Sales to Saudi Arabia
description: LONDON  One day after sanctioning 20 Saudis for human rights violations, Britain on Tuesday sent a very different signal to the government in Riyadh, ending a moratorium on arm sales to Saudi Arabia over its involvement in the bloody conflict in Yemen.

title: United pares its flights after a surge in virus cases crimps demand.
description: United Airlines said on Tuesday that it was cutting back on the August flight schedule it announced just last week because travel demand was sliding again as coronavirus cases surged across much of the country.

title: Judge Puts Cloud Over Settlement of Roundup Cancer Claims
description: An agreement to pay more than $10 billion to settle thousands of claims that the popular weedkiller Roundup causes cancer is at risk of unraveling.

title: Emma Sanders, 91, Dies; Challenged Segregating of Democrats
description: Emma Sanders, one of the few surviving members of a group whose impassioned challenge to an all-white delegation at the 1964 Democratic National Convention brought an end to segregated delegations, died on June 24 in Brandon, Miss. She was 91.

title: Henry Martin, Wry New Yorker Cartoonist, Is Dead at 94
description: A naked man perched atop a bookcase asks his wife, Have you noticed, Myrna, that Im getting more and more neurotic?

title: Testing, School Reopenings, Beach Days: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Scrutinizing SpaceX, NASA Overlooked Some Boeing Software Problems
description: After a couple of rounds of investigation and some soul-searching, NASA and Boeing believe that they have identified what went wrong during a troubled test flight of an uncrewed Boeing spacecraft designed to carry NASA astronauts.

title: New List of Unproduced Plays Tallies Those Disrupted by Pandemic
description: Trying to salvage a spring and summer of shelved and scrapped scripts, the Kilroys, a group of female-identified playwrights and producers, is spotlighting new plays and musicals by female, transgender and nonbinary writers that have had their runs disrupted by the pandemic.

title: A Designer Who Makes Rugs Based on Screenshots
description: Its almost a distasteful color, says the British rug-maker Tom Atton Moore of the vivid chile-pepper red that appears in many of his handmade wool and acrylic creations. The fiery, cautionary shade, little seen within living rooms, is characteristic of his work as a whole, which often has an almost defiantly undomestic feel. Emblazoned with amorphous shapes in bold colors that include electric blue, a corrosive chemical green and rust red, his designs dont immediately evoke a sense of coziness. Only upon closer inspection do the dense, lush textures, subtly uneven surfaces and satisfying thickness of the pieces reveal themselves, encouraging a childlike impulse to sprawl across them.

title: Who Tore Down This Frederick Douglass Statue?
description: The authorities know that a statue of the renowned Black abolitionist Frederick Douglass was torn from its base in a park in Rochester, N.Y., and then dumped some 50 feet away, where it was discovered near a river gorge.

title: Years After 43 Mexican Students Vanished, a Victims Remains Are Found
description: MEXICO CITY  Nearly six years after 43 college students disappeared in rural Mexico, the government announced the first major breakthrough in its investigation on Tuesday: Forensic scientists have identified the remains of one of the students.

title: State Department Bars Chinese Officials Who Restrict Access to Tibet
description: The State Department said on Tuesday that it was barring Chinese authorities from the United States who were found to have restricted journalists, tourists, or diplomats or other American officials from entering Tibetan areas.

title: Trump Administration Signals Formal Withdrawal From W.H.O.
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration has formally notified the United Nations that the United States will withdraw from the World Health Organization, a move that would cut off one of the largest sources of funding from the premier global health organization in the middle of a pandemic.

title: Kevin Rafferty, Atomic Cafe Co-Director, Dies at 73
description: Kevin Rafferty, who with two co-directors gathered archival material that had been created to ease Americans into the nuclear age and turned it into The Atomic Cafe, an acclaimed, darkly comic documentary film released in 1982, died on Thursday  at his home in Manhattan. He was 73.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: The Dire State of Testing
description: Its dj vu. With cases rising in 37 states, scenes from the early days of the pandemic  when people waited for hours in snaking lines to get a test  are being replayed in many parts of the country. Though the U.S. has greatly ramped up its testing capability, performing nearly three times as many tests in June as in April, a surge of infections has ushered in a new crisis.

title: As N.B.A. Teams Arrive at Disney, Focus Turns to Keeping the Virus Out
description: As the first N.B.A. teams arrived at Walt Disney World for the resumption of their season, Commissioner Adam Silver reiterated his conviction that the restricted environment in Florida will be safer for the leagues personnel during the coronavirus pandemic than being anywhere off this campus.

title: Election Day in Paradise (New Jersey)
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Nick Corasaniti, your host on Tuesdays for our coverage of all things media and messaging.

title: Case Against Amy Cooper Lacks Key Element: Victims Cooperation
description: The Manhattan district attorneys decision to charge a white woman with filing a false police report against a Black man in Central Park does not have the support of one key person: the victim himself.

title: Dont Let Russian Meddling Derail Afghanistan Withdrawal Plans
description: Theres a lot still missing from the reports that Russia paid for attacks on American and other coalition forces in Afghanistan. Thats why its critical that emotions and politics be kept at bay until the facts are in. Some important context might come from a hearing on the matter by the House Foreign Affairs Committee on Thursday, even though Mike Pompeo, the secretary of state, has declined to attend.

title: Is the Coronavirus Killing the World Health Organization?
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: The Real Horror of Jaws Isnt the Shark
description: Looking back, I can see it was the definition of overkill. But a few weeks ago, I decided that what my family needed, in the summer of 2020, was a horror movie. So my husband and daughters and I headed to the drive-in movie theater in Wellfleet, Mass., to watch a 45th anniversary rerelease of Jaws.

title: The Inside Story of Why Mary Trump Wrote a Tell-All Memoir
description: For most of her life, Mary L. Trump was shunted aside by her own family.

title: Trump Presses for Schools to Reopen in the Fall
description: President Trump said he would pressure governors and others to reopen schools this fall despite the growing number of coronavirus cases across the United States.

title: Trump Visa Rules Seen as Way to Pressure Colleges on Reopening
description: LOS ANGELES  A directive by the Trump administration that would strip international college students of their U.S. visas if their coursework was entirely online prompted widespread confusion on Tuesday as students scrambled to clarify their statuses and universities reassessed their fall reopening policies amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: David Mitchell: If Wishes Was Horses, a Short Story
description: New fiction: My brains a featherweight stuck in a cage with the Hulk. He just keeps pummeling. From the magazines Decameron Project.

title: 2 People Charged With Hate Crime After Black Lives Matter Mural Is Vandalized
description: Two white people in California were charged on Tuesday with a hate crime and other offenses after video appeared to show them vandalizing a Black Lives Matter mural on July 4, officials said.

title: White House Warns Against Chinese Investment, Citing Risk of Further Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON  White House officials on Tuesday warned a federally administered retirement plan for railroad workers against investing in Chinese companies and said that additional sanctions could be on the way in return for Chinas role in spreading the coronavirus.

title: Charles Yu: Systems, a Short Story
description: New fiction: Misinformation spreads quickly through the population. Misinformation can be transmitted through the mouth or eyes. From the magazines Decameron Project.

title: Trump Leans on Schools to Reopen as Virus Continues Its Spread
description: Follow our live coverage of the 2020 election between Joe Biden and President Trump.

title: Biden Should Not Debate Trump Unless
description: I worry about Joe Biden debating Donald Trump. He should do it only under two conditions. Otherwise, hes giving Trump unfair advantages.

title: In New Book, Trumps Niece Describes Him as Still a Child, Seeking Attention
description: President Trumps niece describes him in a much-awaited tell-all book as a child in an adults body, someone psychologically brutalized and damaged by his sociopath father and who developed defenses of anger and distrust to mask his own chronic insecurities.

title: Etgar Keret: Outside, a Short Story
description: New fiction: A hundred twenty days have passed since someone last touched you. From the magazines Decameron Project.

title: Andrew OHagan: Keepsakes, a Short Story
description: New fiction: Youre addicted to being awkward, his mother said to him that afternoon. Nothings ever your fault. From the magazines Decameron Project.

title: Rachel Kushner: The Girl with the Big Red Suitcase, a Short Story
description: New Fiction: Up close, he saw that she was way beyond his league: in other words, exactly his type. From the magazines Decameron Project.

title: Drivers Are Hitting Protesters as Memes of Car Attacks Spread
description: The driver of a red Toyota first stopped, then unexpectedly accelerated into a crowd of dispersing demonstrators in Bloomington, Ind., on Monday night, injuring two of them in the latest of a disturbing rash of vehicular attacks targeting protesters.

title: Corrections: July 8, 2020
description: An article on Tuesday about the lack of coronavirus testing capacity in U.S. cities described incorrectly the details of recent testing in Wuhan, China. The rapid testing of 6.5 million people was part of a campaign to screen the citys entire population, not in response to a new outbreak. And the testing took place in May, not June.

title: CBS Fires Producer of Magnum P.I. After Workplace Complaints
description: CBS announced on Tuesday that it had fired Peter M. Lenkov, one of its most prolific producers, after a human resources investigation concluded that he had created a toxic workplace environment on his shows.

title: Scrabble Tournaments Move Toward Banning Racial and Ethnic Slurs
description: Josephine Flowers became a ranked, competitive Scrabble player more than a dozen years ago, and to commemorate the moment, she inscribed her custom-built game board with one of her favorite sayings: Never underestimate the power of words.

title: Ta Obreht: The Morningside, a Short Story
description: New fiction: Everyone had left the city  except for the woman on the 14th floor. From the magazines Decameron Project.

description: New fiction: She used to tell me, If he is going to imagine something, let him imagine his home country. From the magazines Decameron Project.

title: Karen Russell: Line 19 Woodstock/Glisan, a Short Story
description: New fiction: Even before the accident that stopped Time, it had been quite a week. From the magazines Decameron Project.
