title: I Felt Defenseless: Seoul Mayors Secretary Speaks Out About Alleged Abuse
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The secretary to one of the most powerful political figures in South Korea, Mayor Park Won-soon of Seoul, described suffering years of abuse and sexual harassment at his hands, calling in her first public statement on Monday for a world where women can be treated like humans.

title: Kristin Urquizas Obituary Blames Politicians for Her Fathers Death
description: When Kristin Urquizas father died last month in Arizona, she wrote an obituary that offered not one but two causes of death: the coronavirus, and ineptitude on the part of government officials.

title: Washington N.F.L. Team to Drop Name
description: First, the city of Washington took down a tribute to George Preston Marshall, the founder of its N.F.L. team, that was in front of the teams old home, Robert F. Kennedy Memorial Stadium. Then the team removed references to Marshall, who named his team the Redskins, from inside its stadium and at its training facility.

title: Are State Parks and Campgrounds Open in California?
description: Good morning.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: What You Get for $4 Million in California
description: A Spanish Colonial Revival house in Ojai, a 1901 Victorian in San Francisco and a Southwestern-style home in Santa Monica.

title: 1-Year-Old Is Shot and Killed at Brooklyn Cookout
description: The cookout in Brooklyn on Sunday night was like many other outdoor parties in New York City during the pandemic. People gathered around a smoldering grill near a park late on a warm summer evening. The group included a 1-year-old boy in a stroller.

title: Were Not an Island: Rural Outbreaks Challenge Oregons Virus Success
description: HERMISTON, Ore.  Jose Garcia reached into the bed of his pickup truck and gingerly withdrew a sealed plastic bag. Inside was a homemade mask Mr. Garcia had been given by a worker in one of the sprawling agricultural fields that surround his home in northeastern Oregon. The mask was made of a single, neatly folded paper towel with a rubber band stapled to each end.

title: Pop Smoke and Hamilton Shake Up the Billboard Chart
description: The posthumous debut album by the Brooklyn rapper Pop Smoke, who was shot and killed in February, debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard album chart this week, arriving as one of the biggest releases of a slow summer in the music business, one of countless industries greatly affected by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: What to Cook Right Now
description: Good morning. It is the chef Paul Prudhommes birthday, and hed have been 80 had he survived the illness that led to his death in 2015. Prudhomme, as William Grimes put it in his obituary for The Times, put the cooking of Louisiana  especially the Cajun gumbos, jambalayas and dirty rice he grew up with  on the American culinary map.

title: $4 Million Homes in California
description: This house was designed by George Washington Smith, a Santa Barbara architect who helped popularize the Spanish Colonial Revival style in the early 20th century. Mr. Smith, a bond trader-turned-painter who took up architecture after designing his own farmhouse in Montecito, was commissioned to build this house and several others in Ojai by Edward Drummond Libbey, a glass manufacturer who owned a number of buildings in the area.

title: Hong Kong Voters Defy Beijing, Endorsing Protest Leaders in Primary
description: HONG KONG  Defying warnings from local officials that the Hong Kong oppositions unofficial primary vote could be illegal under a sweeping new security law, hundreds of thousands of people chose avowedly pro-democracy candidates to run in citywide elections this year, results released Monday showed.

Brave New World Arrives in the Future It Predicted

description: The six lungs were taken from brain-dead patients and offered to transplant surgeons. But at major medical centers, one surgeon after another refused the organs.

description: In 1996, just after he was arrested by Secret Service agents and New Jersey gaming troopers at Caesars Palace in Atlantic City, Louis Colavecchio laughed.

title: I Cant Keep Doing This: Small-Business Owners Are Giving Up
description: On the last Friday of June, after Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas said that bars across the state would have to shut down a second time because coronavirus cases were skyrocketing, Mick Larkin decided he had had enough.

description: CATSKILL, N.Y.  The street painting would stretch about three blocks, from Village Pizza II to the stoplight at the southern end of Main Street, spelling out Black Lives Matter on the pavement.

title: A Big California Quake Just Got a Little Likelier
description: An analysis of recent changes along earthquake faults in Southern California suggests there is an increased possibility of a major quake on the San Andreas Fault, researchers said Monday.

title: Supreme Court, 5-4, Lifts Block on Federal Execution
description: WASHINGTON  In a 5-4 middle-of-the-night decision, the Supreme Court cleared the way for the Justice Department to carry out the first federal execution in more than 17 years, removing a federal judges hold in a decision released early on Tuesday.

title: Los Angeles Apparel Factory Shut Down After More Than 300 Coronavirus Cases
description: In mid-March, as the coronavirus raged across New York, Washington State, California and New Jersey, and the crisis in personal protection equipment shortages grew, Dov Charney of Los Angeles Apparel was one of the first clothing retailers to step into the void.

title: With Robot Deliveries and Outdoor Tents, Campus Dining Will Be Very Different
description: By Becky Vukstas calculations, the new socially distanced dining-hall setup at Furman University in Greenville, S.C., will serve 12 students a minute, or 720 students per hour. Not bad, but still not fast enough to feed the schools 2,700 students in the rush between classes.

title: Suriname Elects a New President, Ending Bouterses Long Rule
description: Suriname elected a new president on Monday, ending the long rule of Desi Bouterse, who dominated the small South American nations politics since its independence through intimidation and charisma.

title: YouTubes Factory Workers Are Angry
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

description: Ashanti Floyd couldnt sleep.

title: Russell Westbrook Says He Tested Positive for the Coronavirus
description: Russell Westbrook of the Houston Rockets, the N.B.A.s most valuable player in the 2016-17 season, said on Monday in a social media post that he had tested positive for the coronavirus. He said he received his test result before the team left for Walt Disney World in Florida, where the N.B.A. is attempting to restart its season.

title: The Case Against Tickling
description: When she was a young child, Ashley Austrews father would hold her down and tickle her so hard she felt momentarily paralyzed. He thought they were having fun  the tickling made her laugh, after all  but she dreaded it. More than once, she rolled off the couch and hit her head on the coffee table.

title: Los Angeles and San Diego Schools to Go Online-Only in the Fall
description: SACRAMENTO  Californias two largest public school districts said on Monday that instruction would be online-only in the fall, in the latest sign that school administrators are increasingly unwilling to risk crowding students back into classrooms until the coronavirus is fully under control.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell Tried to Hide When F.B.I. Knocked, Prosecutors Say
description: When F.B.I. agents went to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell on the morning of July 2 on a remote property in New Hampshire, they broke through her locked gate, approached the front door and announced themselves, telling her to open the door, federal prosecutors said in newly filed court papers on Monday.

title: A Colorful Townhouse With Nods to James Turrell
description: After purchasing a majestic but dilapidated 19th-century brownstone in Brooklyns Clinton Hill neighborhood, a husband-and-wife couple  she a public-school art teacher and artist, he a tech venture-capital investor  set about finding an architect to revive the four-story, four-bedroom house. Built in 1899, the 3,600-square-foot landmarked building had been abandoned for over 20 years, and while its oversize backyard and sweeping Douglas fir staircase remained grand and inviting, the paint was peeling, the plaster was crumbling and the red oak floors were coated in two decades worth of grime. Each half of the couple independently sourced suggestions for an architect, asking their respective friends and family members for recommendations. But when they reconvened, each prepared to argue for their own incontestable pick, they found themselves blurting out the same name: Michael Chen.

title: Naya Rivera Is Found Dead at Lake Piru, Officials Say
description: Investigators on Monday were confident they had found the body of Naya Rivera, a star in the series Glee, almost a week after she was reported missing at a lake in California, the authorities said.

title: Trump in a Mask, at Last!
description: To the Editor:

title: Hong Kong Disneyland to Close Again, Days After Disney World Reopens
description: Hong Kong Disneyland will close again on Wednesday to comply with a government-directed rollback of public activities in the region after an increase in coronavirus infections, the Walt Disney Company said on Monday. Disney called the closing of the theme park temporary and said its resort hotels at the Lantau Island complex would remain open.

title: He Beat Trump and Weinstein. Why Is This D.A.s Standing Still Shaky?
description: He just won a landmark victory in the Supreme Court over President Trump that paved the way for prosecutors to obtain the presidents tax returns. In February, he won a conviction against Harvey Weinstein in perhaps the biggest criminal case to arise from the #MeToo movement.

title: Best Guess on When Business Travel Will Recover? It Could be Years
description: While business travel evaporated in a flash when the coronavirus hit, it may take two to three years for it to fully recover  far longer than many travel experts initially predicted.

title: How to Help Kids Cope With Moving
description: When my husband and I decided to buy a new house at the end of last year, we spent very little time considering what the move would mean to our two daughters, who were 3 and 22 months at the time.

title: The Massacre That Destroyed Tulsas Black Wall Street
description: TULSA, Okla.  Incited by a salacious and largely fabricated news story about a young Black man assaulting a white girl, a lynch mob showed up at the Tulsa city jail, where he was being held. A group of African-Americans, many of them soldiers who had returned from fighting the First World War, rushed over to help guard the young man. Fighting broke out, then shooting.

title: Manchester City Won. Now Brace for the Losses.
description: MANCHESTER, England  Manchester City has its answer: the answer it wanted, the answer it was adamant, right from the start, was the only one possible.

title: Womens Rights Activists Describe Seoul Mayors Alleged Abuse
description: A womens rights activist group in Seoul called for an investigation into abuse allegations against Mayor Park Won-soon, who committed suicide last week.

title: Judy Dyble, Singer in Fairport Convention and Beyond, Dies at 71
description: Judy Dyble, a singer and songwriter who was in the first recorded lineup of the British folk-rock institution Fairport Convention before going on to an extensive, though interrupted, recording career, died on Sunday in Oxfordshire, England. She was 71.

title: Soap With a Brisket Back Story
description: Making soap basically requires two ingredients: fat and lye. Micha Magid, an owner of Mighty Quinns Barbeque, with a number of stores in New York and New Jersey, had a lot of fat in his kitchen. We would trim the whole briskets before smoking them and were throwing away tons and tons of fat, he said. I was looking for a way to repurpose it. He started making soap with the fat, plus lye, peppermint oil and organic charcoal. It seemed to be a really good idea now that everyone has to wash their hands all the time, he said. The blocks of charcoal gray soap are effective, and are sold in its stores and on the companys website. Mighty Quinns is donating 25 percent of sales to No Kid Hungry.

title: Brexit Border Bureaucracy Looms for Truckers, Pet Owners and Travelers
description: LONDON  No more seamless access to medical care. A spike in cellphone bills. And months of preparation if you are bringing the dog.

title: Bahrain to Execute 2 Shiite Protesters After Years of Desperate Appeals
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Two Bahraini men who say they were tortured into making false confessions were sentenced to death for the fifth time on Monday in what international rights groups called another stain on Bahrains record of imprisoning, torturing and executing government critics.

title: McEnany Plays Down Tensions Between White House and Fauci

title: Big Friendship, by Aminatou Sow and Ann Friedman: An Excerpt
description: Were now a full decade into our friendship. Weve lived apart for more than twice as long as we lived in the same city. We still see a lot of each other and talk almost daily, although the years of watching TV on the couch or lingering at happy hour every week feel very far away. The truth is that its harder for us to fit into each others lives than it once wasand we work together.

Jeff Sessions, the Alabama Republican and former attorney general who is trying to reclaim his old Senate seat, on Monday declined to answer directly whether he would support his opponent, Tommy Tuberville, in the general election in the event that Mr. Sessions does not win Tuesdays runoff race against him.

title: Newsom Announces Rollbacks in Californias Reopening Plans
description: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California said he was moving to close indoor operations for restaurants, wineries, movie theaters and zoos. Bars would be forced to close all operations.

title: Remaining PGA Tour Events Will Not Host Fans
description: The remainder of the PGA Tour schedule this season will be played without spectators after the organizers of four tournaments announced on Monday that they would close their events to the public.

title: Monthly U.S. Budget Deficit Soared to Record $864 Billion in June
description: WASHINGTON  The United States budget deficit grew to a record $864 billion for June as the federal government pumped huge sums of money into the economy to prop up workers and businesses affected by the coronavirus, the Treasury Department said on Monday, an amount that is expected to grow as a surge in cases portends prolonged economic pain.

title: NBC Starts Streaming With a TV-Style Platform, Peacock
description: NBCUniversals streaming platform, Peacock, looks a whole lot like broadcast TV.

title: Zindzi Mandela, Activist in South Africa and Ambassador, Dies at 59
description: JOHANNESBURG  Zindziswa Mandela, the youngest daughter of Nelson Mandela and Winnie Madikizela-Mandela, who found her own voice as an activist and poet, died in Johannesburg on Monday. She was 59.

title: Florida Sheriffs Deputy Is Fired After Pointing Gun at Unarmed Man
description: A sergeant with the Hillsborough County Sheriffs Office in Tampa, Fla., has been fired and charged with assault after he pointed a gun at an unarmed man for refusing to give his name, the sheriff said.

title: These Are the Deutsche Bank Executives Responsible for Serving Jeffrey Epstein
description: Jeffrey Epstein, the sex criminal and financier, didnt act alone. Now we know in vivid detail who some of his financial enablers were: executives and bankers at Deutsche Bank.

title: U.S. Says Most of Chinas Claims in South China Sea Are Illegal
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced on Monday that Chinas expansive maritime claims across most of the South China Sea were completely unlawful, setting up potential military confrontations with Beijing and sanctions against companies as the United States seeks to push back Chinese activity in the region.

title: 17 States Sue to Block Student Visa Rules
description: A Trump administration effort to force foreign college students to take in-person classes in the fall or lose their visas has prompted a high-stakes legal battle between the White House and some of Americas top universities, with 17 states and the District of Columbia joining the fray on Monday in a lawsuit that calls the policy senseless and cruel.

title: Want to Abolish the Police? Consider Becoming an Officer Instead
description: For the past few years, Ive taught a seminar on the sociology of the police at Colby College in Maine. My students, mostly progressive, ask me whether theres anything they can do to help solve some of the serious problems that exist in policing, such as racial inequities in the use of force, the overpolicing of minority neighborhoods and rogue officers who lie to justify arrests. Today, young people all over the country are asking the same question.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: Los Angeles and San Diego Counties said schools would be online-only in the fall, citing a surge in infections that pose too much risk for students and teachers. The unified school districts, with around 825,000 students, are the largest so far in the U.S. to abandon plans for even a partial physical return.

title: Trump Continues Criticism of Movement to Defund the Police
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Monday assailed a broad movement to defund police departments, invoking the kind of pro-police language that won him support with the law enforcement community in 2016 and ignoring the calls for reform that have helped shape this election.

title: For Native American Activists, Washington Name Change Was a Long Time Coming
description: Activists have spent decades pressuring professional sports leagues, college programs and high schools to abandon Native American names and imagery for their teams.

title: Body of Naya Rivera Is Found at California Lake, Sheriff Says
description: Ventura County Sheriff Bill Ayub said search teams recovered Ms. Riveras body on Monday, almost a week after she was reported missing.

title: Headed to the Convention? Not I, More Republicans Are Saying
description: [Update: Trump abruptly cancels Republican Convention in Jacksonville.]

title: DeVos Abandons a Lifetime of Local Advocacy to Demand Schools Reopen
description: WASHINGTON  As the nations public schools plunged into crisis at the outset of the coronavirus outbreak, Education Secretary Betsy DeVos stuck to the message of decades of conservative education advocacy.

title: The N.Y.P.D. Has Rejected Reform for Decades. It Cant Anymore.
description: In New York, a 1-year-old boy was fatally shot over the weekend, one of the latest victims in a surge of violence that has rattled an already traumatized city. As of Monday, New York City had had 634 shootings this year, up from 394 at the same time last year, according to Police Department data.

title: Fauci Back at the White House, a Day After Trump Aides Tried to Undermine Him
description: WASHINGTON  A day after President Trumps press office tried to undermine the reputation of the nations top infectious disease expert with an anonymously attributed list of what it said were his misjudgments in the early days of the coronavirus, Dr. Anthony S. Fauci returned to the White House on Monday.

title: Ted Cruz Was Seen on a Flight Without a Mask. His Office Says He Followed Airline Policy.
description: American Airlines said on Monday that it had reached out to Senator Ted Cruz after a widely shared photograph showed him not wearing a mask on one of its flights.

title: A Reissue of John Cages Mushroom Book
description: The composer John Cage was also a passionate mycologist. He even sold the fungal fruits of his foraging to the Four Seasons Restaurant in Manhattan. In 1972, he wrote a limited-edition book about mushrooms with Alexander H. Smith and Lois Long. Now the Mushroom Book, a reproduction with lithographic illustrations, anecdotes, poetry and even authors scribblings, has been reissued in a boxed set with A Mycological Foray by Cage and others. The collectors edition, limited to 500 copies, also includes a box of postcards with Cages mushroom recipes; the regular edition of 4,500 omits the recipe box.

title: New Seasoned Fonio Pilafs From Pierre Thiam
description: Pierre Thiam, a native of Senegal, has become the American ambassador for fonio, the versatile West African grain. Hes written a book about it. Now in addition to selling plain fonio, which cooks up like fine couscous, his company, Yoll, has introduced tasty, efficient fonio pilafs. They are preseasoned with several flavor profiles: Yassa, with onion, lime and chile; Jollof, with tomato and bell pepper; Afro-Funk, with herbs and fermented locust bean; Dakar Curry, with currants; and Greens, with moringa and spinach. Each package, with the addition of some oil and water, makes enough fine-textured light and fluffy grain for four as a main or six as a side dish.

title: A Rare Honey for Your Table
description: Black sage, a spiky shrublike plant native to Southern California and Northern Mexico, flowers only about every three years. So black sage honey is a rare thing for the Savannah Bee Company, which buys it from a beekeeper who only gets three to four yields a decade. The honey is earthy and a bit rustic, with a distinctive spiciness. Drizzle it on grilled peaches.

title: A Bakery Gets Into the Ice Cream Business
description: Anna Gordons the Good Batch Bakery has been a staple in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, for several years. In summer it even offered ice cream sandwiches made with its own cookies. On Wednesday Ms. Gordon is opening a scoop shop across the street. In addition to some new flavors like sprinkletown, coffee ganache and caramel brownie swirl (made with her bakerys brownies), shes serving ice cream sandwiches, sundaes, cones and cups. There will be free scoops to celebrate the opening from Wednesday through Friday.

title: Cocktail Veterans Create a Few Canned Drinks
description: A few heavy hitters from the New York cocktail scene have collaborated on a new line of canned cocktails called Social Hour. Julie Reiner and Tom Macy, two of the owners of the Brooklyn cocktail bar Clover Club, are providing the mixological inspiration, while some of the base spirits will come from the New York Distilling Company in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The gin and tonic will use the distillers Perrys Tot Navy Strength Gin and a custom-made tonic water. The whiskey mule will combine the distillers Ragtime Rye with a handmade ginger beer. There is also an Italian aperitivo-style Pacific Spritz. Social Hour will be available in New York and New Jersey beginning Aug. 1.

title: In Some Countries, Normal Life Is Back. Not Here.
description: If youre lucky enough to live in New Zealand, the coronavirus nightmare has been mostly over since June. After more than two weeks with no new cases, the government lifted almost all restrictions that month. The borders are still shut, but inside the country, normal life returned.

title: Navy Warship Is Still Ablaze, and Now Tilting to One Side
description: Hundreds of Navy sailors were continuing on Monday to battle a raging fire on the U.S.S. Bonhomme Richard at a San Diego naval base, one of the worst blazes to ever engulf an American warship outside of combat.

title: Millions Have Lost Health Insurance in Pandemic-Driven Recession
description: WASHINGTON  The coronavirus pandemic stripped an estimated 5.4 million American workers of their health insurance between February and May, a stretch in which more adults became uninsured because of job losses than have ever lost coverage in a single year, according to a new analysis.

title: New York Judge Clears Publication of Trump Tell-All
description: A New York judge ruled on Monday that Mary L. Trump, the niece of President Trump, could legally go ahead with the publication of her explosive tell-all memoir about her famous family, ending a whirlwind of last-minute litigation to try to stop the book.

title: Inside Democrats 2020 Plan
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: A Mayor Committed Suicide. His Accuser Wont Be Heard.
description: An elaborate public funeral was held on Monday in Seoul, South Korea, in honor of the citys mayor, Park Won-soon, a prominent human rights lawyer and confidant of President Moon Jae-in. Mr. Park was found dead last week, by suicide, hours after a personal assistant in his office filed a claim of sexual abuse and harassment against him.

title: Tucker Carlson to Take Long-Planned Vacation After Writers Resignation
description: The Fox News star Tucker Carlson said on Monday evening that he would leave on a vacation, starting immediately, days after a writer on his program, Blake Neff, resigned over racist, sexist and misogynist messages that Mr. Neff published pseudonymously on an online message board.

title: Speaking on Charity Scandal, Trudeau Adopts a Now-Familiar Tone of Contrition
description: After digging in his heels for days, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada changed tack on Monday and apologized for taking part in a decision to award a no-bid government contract to a charity deeply connected to his family.

title: Trying to Look Cultured
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Stella Zawistowski (ne Daily) made a rousing New York Times Crossword debut in 2004 with Bruce Venzke. For four years, the two constructors were regular collaborators. And then, in 2008, Ms. Zawistowski vanished from the Times Crossword page.

title: Watch the Milan Digital Fashion Week Shows
description: The live shows are over for this experimental bit of a Milan Digital Fashion Week. Well be updating this page now with some of our favorite shows  like Gucci, Prada and Versace. The presenting body is the Camera Nazionale della Moda Italiana.

title: Roger Stone Denies Withholding the Goods on Trump in Exchange for Clemency
description: WASHINGTON  Roger J. Stone Jr., the political operative convicted of lying and obstructing an investigation into President Trumps campaign, denied on Monday night that he withheld incriminating information about the president before receiving clemency keeping him out of prison.

title: San Diego Sheriffs Deputy Is Charged With Second-Degree Murder
description: The San Diego County District Attorneys Office on Monday charged a sheriffs deputy with second-degree murder in the killing of an unarmed man in May  a rare instance of criminal charges being brought against an officer for actions on the job.

title: Hong Kong Outbreak, Polish President, Russia-Taliban: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: How the United Arab Emirates Set Its Sights on Mars
description: As a girl growing up in Abu Dhabi, one of the United Arab Emirates, Sarah al-Amiri looked at an astronomy book with a photograph of Andromeda, the giant galaxy neighboring our Milky Way.

title: Corrections: July 14, 2020
description: An article on Thursday about the impact of the pandemic on Puerto Rico misidentified the location of the headquarters of the Puerto Rico Financial Oversight and Management Board. It is now meeting in San Juan, P.R., not New York.

title: Quotation of the Day: Pressure Finally Knocks Name From Teams Grip
description: The name is always the hardest part. You get one chance to make this right for the next 80 years.

title: N.Y.C.s Wave of Gun Violence Continues With 3 Drive-By Shootings
description: Five people were shot in Brooklyn on Monday in what the police described as three drive-by attacks within 20 minutes and about a mile of each other, continuing a wave of gun violence that has gripped New York this summer.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Dirty John and The Business of Drugs
description: DIRTY JOHN: THE BETTY BRODERICK STORY 10 p.m. on USA. Following the success of  its first season, which adapted the hit podcast Dirty John for television, this anthology series tracks the very public unraveling of a marriage. It stars Amanda Peet as Betty Broderick, and Christian Slater as her husband, Dan, who seemed to lead an idyllic life in Southern California in the 80s until Dan, a successful medical-malpractice lawyer, hired a new legal assistant named Linda Kolkena (Rachel Keller). Dan and Bettys marriage spats and divorce played out in La Jolla for more than five years, until Betty shot and killed Dan and Linda, who had married, while they slept. The season finale wraps up Bettys case, which, as The New York Times reported in 1991, divided this normally placid city and has drawn attention to the issue of domestic psychological abuse.

title: Jimmy Fallon Predicts Trump Will Say He Was the First to Wear a Mask
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Many of us are stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: As Europes Economies Reopen, Consumers Go on a Spending Spree
description: PARIS  Clmentine Sebert buzzed through an Ikea furniture store during her lunch break, filling her cart with decorative cushions, a new nightstand, lamps and a small rug. After being cooped up for two months during Frances coronavirus quarantine, she was back to work at the firm where she is a legal counselor  and ready to spend.

title: Grant Imahara, Engineer Who Co-Hosted MythBusters, Dies at 49
description: Grant Imahara, an electrical engineer who co-hosted the pop science show MythBusters on the Discovery Channel and operated robots in the Star Wars prequels and other major Hollywood films, has died. He was 49.

title: After Months of Debate, England Requires Face Masks for Shoppers
description: LONDON  Britons, a people famously averse to seeming ruffled in times of distress, have taken slowly, if at all, to face masks during the coronavirus pandemic. Jim Williams says people in his home city, Newcastle, have even yelled at him and shot him angry looks when he wore one.

title: How to Mend a Pair of Jeans
description: Cut a patch of denim bigger than your hole, says Atsushi Futatsuya, 36, a sewing teacher who lives in Lewisburg, Pa. He grew up in Japan, a descendant of many generations of experts in a kind of decorative needlework called sashiko. Wives of rural, working-class farmers and fishermen developed the stitching technique as early as the 1600s as a means to reinforce and mend their clothing. The idea is that one jacket would be passed down three generations or more, Futatsuya says. Different regions developed dozens of patterns, of which Futatsuya knows more than 100; his two favorites are asanoha (six-pointed stars) and shippo (overlapping circles). Since 2017, he has spent hundreds of hours covering jeans he owns in stitched patterns to make them stronger. If, after wearing, he notices threads fraying, hell add stitching before the fabric tears. Patching should be your last resort, he says.

title: The Housing Boom and Bust, Seen From the Front Lines
description: UNDERWATERHow Our American Dream of Homeownership Became a NightmareBy Ryan Dezember

title: Meet the Man Who Spun the Media, Scammed Followers and Named Himself King
description: THE KING OF CONFIDENCE A Tale of Utopian Dreamers, Frontier Schemers, True Believers, False Prophets, and the Murder of an American Monarch By Miles Harvey

title: New & Noteworthy, From French Pancakes to a Bipartisan Road Trip
description: SCORPIONFISH, by Natalie Bakopoulos. (Tin House, paper, $16.95.) Across a balcony in Athens, a grounded sea captain and a grieving academic spend summer nights sharing beers and stories of heartbreak in Bakopouloss elegant, atmospheric second novel.

title: I Didnt Mean to Adopt a Dozen Pet Snails
description: If parcels arrived in the early weeks of the lockdown, the wariness with which we collected them off the doorstep  fingertips tented, sweat on brow  arose not only out of a fear of surfaces teeming with microbes, but because their contents belonged to a future we would not inhabit. These deliveries, sundry things we had ordered, were possessions from a different stream of time: one in which my partner, a playwright, would be staging a new show in a London festival. But now the play was canceled, the festival too, and with it the pell-mell that typically attends last rehearsals.

title: The Pandemic Could Get Much, Much Worse. We Must Act Now.
description: This article has been updated to reflect news developments.

title: When Miami Was Awash in Drugs, Crime and Social Unrest
description: THE YEAR OF DANGEROUS DAYSRiots, Refugees, and Cocaine in Miami 1980By Nicholas Griffin

title: Young, in Love and Trying to Bring Down the Third Reich
How Are You Telling Children the Story of the Pandemic?
description: How will children make sense of the times we are living through? How can parents help them form  and understand  the narrative, even when they themselves feel worried, overwhelmed and unsure?

title: I Dont Want to Spread Covid-19. Can I Sit Out the Protests?
description: In normal times, I would feel an obligation to take part in the recent protests against police brutality. Im worried, however, that these gatherings could lead to a coronavirus outbreak. Black Americans are suffering from Covid-19 at a disproportionately high rate  I dont want to endanger the very lives that this movement is seeking to protect. I have done what I can to speak out in other ways, from signing petitions to making donations and even making a Black Lives Matter sign and carrying it for a solo march around my neighborhood (which definitely attracted a lot of laughter and scorn). I feel bad for not getting out there and standing up for whats right. Is it ethical to support these protests only from a distance? Name Withheld

title: His Mother Was Neglectful, Drunk and Absolutely Riveting to Him
description: FILTHY BEASTSA MemoirBy Kirkland Hamill

title: Why Were Losing the Battle With Covid-19
Scientists Find an Earthquakes Toll in an Organisms DNA
description: Waving fronds of seaweed form a peaceful underwater scene, with dappled sunlight pouring down. Hidden in the organisms genes, however, may be evidence of the planets past geological violence.

title: 10 Theses About Cancel Culture
description: Cancel culture is destroying liberalism. No, cancel culture doesnt exist. No, it has always existed; remember when Brutus and Cassius canceled Julius Caesar? No, it exists but its just a bunch of rich entitled celebrities complaining that people can finally talk back to them on Twitter. No, it doesnt exist except when its good and the canceled deserve it. Actually, it does exist, but  well, look, I cant explain it to you until youve read at least four open letters on the subject.

title: Flour and Toilet Paper Are Back at N.Y. Supermarkets, but Theres a Catch
description: Shoppers no longer stare at aisles devoid of toilet paper. Pasta, in many shapes and sizes, is back in abundance. And eager home bakers can restart their mixers and ovens now that flour and yeast have finally reappeared.

title: She Went to Prison for Killing Her Husband. The Pandemic Set Her Free.
description: On a Thursday morning in May, three days after Foroozan was freed from prison, she left her mothers house to go to the market. It was the first time in six years that she had set foot on the streets of Herat, the capital city of a province of the same name in western Afghanistan. As she made her way through crowds of men wearing masks, she became lightheaded, as if the world was revolving around her head. It was nothing like how she had imagined it. When I was in prison, I thought the outside world is heaven and those who are released, theyre on their way to heaven, she said. But now, finally experiencing it for herself, she found it alienating and even frightening. I thought everyone was staring at me, she said. Pointing their fingers toward me while whispering, as if they knew I was a prisoner, but of course it was all in my head.

title: This Year Will End Eventually. Document It While You Can.
description: A few weeks ago, a nerdy joke went viral on Twitter: Future historians will be asked which quarter of 2020 they specialize in.

title: Self-Care for Black Journalists
description: Heat flushed Nateleg Whaleys body as she wrote a news article about the shooting by police that killed Breonna Taylor. Ms. Whaley, a journalist, figured she was tired. Then came the mental fog, digestive issues and blurred vision. When these seemingly separate issues snowballed into a panic attack and a trip to the emergency room in late May, Ms. Whaley, 31, who lives in Brooklyn, connected the dots.

title: After a Trail of Tears, Justice for Indian Country
description: TULSA, Okla.  It was an ordinary July morning in the Arts District of the Muscogee Creek Nation territory here. Already hot and set to get hotter. I was inside my house fooling with some lyrics when my husband burst in. We won! he announced. The cellphone in his hand carried the breaking news. We won the McGirt v. Oklahoma decision!

title: Gotham Refuses to Get Scared: In 1918, Theaters Stayed Open
description: War plays were big on Broadway in the fall of 1918. With the nation sending soldiers to Europe to fight in World War I, spectacles like the Ziegfeld Follies wrapped themselves in patriotism.

title: G.A.O.: Trump Boosts Deregulation by Undervaluing Cost of Climate Change
description: WASHINGTON  A federal report released on Tuesday found the Trump administration set a rock-bottom price on the damages done by greenhouse gas emissions, enabling the government to justify the costs of repealing or weakening dozens of climate change regulations.

title: Black Behind the Wheel
description: Driving across Woodward Avenue in Detroit a few weeks ago amid a spirited George Floyd demonstration  this one a 30-mile motorcade into the suburbs, billed as the I Have a Dream Protest Cruise  my mind drifted strangely to an empty two-lane highway in Arkansas near the Texas border. The memory was jarring, sweeping me away from this raucous caravan  honking horns, Black-power fists thrust from car windows, the whir of sirens  back to my youth in the spring of 1986.

title: Your New Home Office May Be in the Backyard
description: When James and Meg Wilson began working from home in March, they realized their house in Oakland, Calif., would need a proper home office in a hurry. Mr. Wilson, 36, works in finance, and Ms. Wilson, 36, is a nurse practitioner engaged in telehealth.

title: We Can Still Get the Truth From Roger Stone
description: Attorney General Bill Barr reportedly opposed President Trumps commutation of Roger Stones prison sentence for seven felonies  the latest act by this administration to undermine the rule of law. If Mr. Barrs resistance is to be believed, the Department of Justice still has a path to vindicate the rule of law by putting Mr. Stone before a grand jury.

title: The QAnon Candidates Are Here. Trump Has Paved Their Way.
description: A Republican Senate candidate recently declared herself one of the thousands of digital soldiers in service of QAnon, a convoluted pro-Trump conspiracy theory about a deep state of child-molesting Satanist traitors plotting against the president. A congressional candidate in Colorado who made approving comments about QAnon bested a five-term Republican incumbent in a primary last month.

title: I Went Home to Texas to Cover the Virus. Then My Family Got It.
description: McALLEN, Texas  There were many reasons for a special level of alarm when the coronavirus swept out of Texas biggest cities in recent weeks and arrived with force in the Rio Grande Valley.

title: Want More Diversity? Some Experts Say Reward C.E.O.s for It
description: When Charles E. Jones, the chief executive of a large Ohio-based utility, realized that his senior executives werent fully behind his push to hire and promote people of color and women, he decided to do something to get their attention.

title: New York Confronts Second-Wave Risk: Visitors From Florida and Texas
description: New York, once the center of the coronavirus pandemic, has so successfully stemmed the outbreak that its death and hospitalization rates have plummeted and it has among the lowest infection rates in the country.

title: A Racial Awakening in France, Where Race Is a Taboo Topic
description: PARIS  Growing up in France, Maboula Soumahoro never thought of herself as Black.

title: Filthy Beasts, by Kirkland Hamill: An Excerpt
description: I remember them laughing.

title: What to Know About N.Y.s Traveler Restrictions
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Florida Breaks Its Record for Most Coronavirus Deaths in a Day
description: Follow our live updates of coronavirus cases and deaths globally.

title: The 6 Things You Need to Preserve the Summers Bounty
description: As soon as I get used to the towering stacks of fragrant peaches and plump berries at the farmers market, the summer season comes to an end, and theyre gone. It always seems to go by in the blink of an eye.

title: Its Like a War. Revisiting Dr. Fabiano Di Marco.
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: As Europes economies reopen, consumers go on a spending spree.
description: Consumers in Europe are going on a shopping spree as their economies reopen, offering hope that a fragile recovery from a deep pandemic-induced recession may be taking hold.

title: KFC closes its dining rooms in Florida amid a surge in virus cases.
description: KFC, the fried chicken chain, closed dining rooms in all 40 of its corporate-owned restaurants in Florida on Monday as coronavirus cases in the state continued to skyrocket.

title: Bidens Big Opportunity
description: Joe Biden doesnt seem like an obvious candidate to be a transformational president.

title: Stocks end the day with a loss after erasing early gains.
description: Monday proved to be another turbulent day for Wall Street, with stocks reversing an early gain that had briefly lifted the S&P 500 back into positive territory for the year.

title: Famous Paintings Go on Show, Without a Canvas in Sight
description: BORDEAUX, France  On the walls inside of a former World War II submarine base, a huge Gustav Klimt tree expands its branches and a gold Paul Klee fish floats by. The bright, changing colors of these projections are reflected by four saltwater pools. Visitors walk along gangways, watching the floor-to-ceiling digital animations based on famous works by Klimt, Klee and Egon Schiele.

title: Britains economic recovery disappointed in May as businesses started to reopen.
description: May was supposed to be the first month of Britains economic recovery, when some restrictions on business activity were eased after the near-total lockdown of April. Some economists predicted the economy would grow by 5.5 percent after contracting by nearly 7 percent in March and a further 20 percent in April. But the data announced Tuesday was greeted as a disappointment, showing just a 1.8 percent increase from the month before.

title: F11 and Be There Review: Burk Uzzle, a Photographer Worth Knowing
description: Documentaries about photographers seem to grow on trees these days. Burk Uzzle, the subject of this unusually distinctive one, doesnt have the name recognition of Bill Cunningham or Jay Maisel, two lensmen highlighted in recent features, but he should.

title: Trumps Convention? Everybody Just Assumes No One Is Going
description: [Update: Trump abruptly cancels Republican Convention in Jacksonville.]

title: Big Blank Checks
description: Want this delivered to your inbox each morning? Sign up here.

title: Pandemic preparations cut JPMorgans second quarter earnings in half.
description: JPMorgan Chase on Tuesday revealed that it had earned $4.7 billion during the months of April, May and June, just under half of what it earned during the same period a year ago, as it diverted billions of dollars to a reserve fund in order to prepare for a potential economic shock.

title: U.K. Bars Huawei for 5G as Tech Battle Between China and the West Escalates
description: LONDON  Britain announced on Tuesday that it would ban equipment from the Chinese technology giant Huawei from the countrys high-speed wireless network, a victory for the Trump administration that escalates the battle between Western powers and China over critical technology.

title: He Changed His Countrys Name. Will North Macedonia Punish Him?
description: SKOPJE, North Macedonia  Zoran Zaev, the front-runner in a general election on Wednesday in North Macedonia, got more done during his 30 months as prime minister than most Macedonian politicians did in the nearly 30 years since the country won independence from Yugoslavia.

title: Review: Peacocks Brave New World Is Neither Brave Nor New
description: Aldous Huxleys 1932 novel Brave New World famously imagined a future society in which people were enslaved to pleasure. The futures diversions were so absorbing that they commanded attention over everything else.

title: Alabama Votes for Tommy Tuberville, and Democrats Name a Challenger in Maine
description: This briefing has ended. Follow the latest Biden vs Trump 2020 live elections briefing here.

title: Newsom Rolls Back Reopening in California
description: Good morning.

title: Wells Fargo reports first quarterly loss in more than a decade.
description: Wells Fargo on Tuesday reported its first quarterly loss since 2008, losing $2.4 billion as the pandemics economic shocks ravaged nearly every line of its business.

title: Citigroup reports a 73 percent drop in quarterly profit.
description: Citigroup said Tuesday that its quarterly profit fell 73 percent as it set aside $5.6 billion to cover future loan losses triggered by the widespread unemployment caused by the pandemic.

title: The Black Photographer Making History at Vanity Fair
description: Until about two weeks ago, Dario Calmese didnt know he was the first Black photographer to shoot the cover of Vanity Fair. But he had a suspicion, so he asked the editors, who went digging.

title: Going Deep Green, Office Buildings Give Back to the Planet
description: For a couple of decades, many in the real estate industry have been trying to make buildings green, replacing conventionally made materials with sustainable ones and installing energy-efficient systems. Buildings have a heavy environmental footprint, so the upshot of all this tinkering has been structures that are less harmful to the planet.

title: Caught in Ideological Spiral, U.S. and China Drift Toward Cold War
description: One by one, the United States has hit at the core tenets of Xi Jinpings vision for a rising China ready to assume the mantle of superpower.

title: Government Carries Out First Federal Execution in 17 Years
description: WASHINGTON  Hours after the Supreme Court rejected a last-minute legal challenge on a 5-to-4 vote, the Justice Department put a man to death for his role in the 1996 murder of a family of three, the first federal execution in more than 17 years.

title: Automakers Are Making Cars, but Virus Surge Puts That at Risk
description: Automakers are back to building cars and trucks at full speed  at least for now. But as coronavirus cases rise across much of the country, it may become difficult for the companies to keep at it.

title: Hannibal Buress Meets the Moment
description: In his dynamite, accidentally topical new special Miami Nights, released for free on YouTube over the July Fourth weekend, Hannibal Buress describes himself as medium famous, which he says translates to: I constantly talk people out of recognizing me.

title: Andy Samberg Makes Each Day Count With Thundercat and Not Too Much Bourbon
description: As a Hollywood multihyphenate, Andy Samberg reads  and rejects  a lot of scripts. But about 30 pages into Palm Springs, he started thinking that the answer was going to be a rare yes.

title: After 43 Years, Mossy Kilchers Folk Songs for Alaska Get a Second Life
description: In her first memory, Mossy Kilcher, then 3 years old, is standing on a windswept Alaskan beach in 1945, holding her fathers hand as thundering waves crash at their feet. Surrounded by rugged cliffs and the seemingly endless expanse of Kachemak Bay, she realizes for the first time that any of this can kill her.

title: Disabled Do-It-Yourselfers Lead Way to Technology Gains
Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 3: On NASA Names Headquarters After Its First Black Female Engineer, Mary Jackson
description: Thank you to the more than 890 teenagers who participated in the third week of our 10-week Summer Reading Contest, and congratulations to Chandini, our winner, as well as to our many runners-up and honorable mentions.

title: Virgin Atlantic secures a $1.5 billion private rescue deal.
description: Richard Branson has reached a 1.2 billion pound ($1.5 billion) deal with two credit-card payment processing companies and an American hedge fund to rescue Virgin Atlantic from financial collapse after the British government rejected the airlines request for a loan.

title: Massachusetts Sues Uber and Lyft Over the Status of Drivers
description: Uber and Lyft should treat their drivers in Massachusetts as employees with the right to receive benefits, instead of misclassifying them as independent contractors, the states attorney general said in a lawsuit filed against the ride-hailing companies.

title: As Training Camps Near, N.F.L. and Players Debate Protocols
description: As sports leagues rushed to delay or cancel events in March, the N.F.L. made a bold promise to start its season on time and unaltered. Since then, the league has held most of its normal activities, including free agency, the draft and off-season workouts, on time, though remotely rather than in person.

title: The Fight Over the Future of the Democratic Party
description: THE PEOPLE, NOA Brief History of Anti-PopulismBy Thomas FrankECONOMIC DIGNITYBy Gene Sperling

title: A New To-Go Window From an Uptown Fixture
description: The new Butterfield Market, a branch of the 105-year-old store on Lexington Avenue, is moving into the spacious storefront once occupied by Dean & DeLuca, but it wont be ready until the fall. Evan Obsatz, one of the  owners (along with his sister, Joelle, and his father, Alan), said the neighborhood had been quiet: I hope the Upper East Side gets busier in September. For now, hes offering a taste of the stores specialty, frozen yogurt, from a window on the 85th Street side, near Madison Avenue. But the window is not just about frozen yogurt. Sandwiches, cold soups and composed salads like salmon with potatoes, haricots verts, tomatoes and arugula, are some of the options sold to take away. There are benches along the Madison Avenue side of the store, whose name recalls its telephone exchange, dating back to the days when such things existed. Remember the movie Butterfield 8? (Opens Wednesday)

title: This Pickle Is a Cake
description: Over the past week, social media has been flooded with videos of knives slicing into ordinary objects only to reveal that they are actually made of cake.

title: Biden Announces $2 Trillion Climate Plan
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. announced on Tuesday a new plan to spend $2 trillion over four years to significantly escalate the use of clean energy in the transportation, electricity and building sectors, part of a suite of sweeping proposals designed to create economic opportunities and strengthen infrastructure while also tackling climate change.

title: C.D.C. Employees Accuse Agency of Toxic Culture of Racial Aggressions
description: More than 1,000 employees of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have signed a letter calling for the agency to address a pervasive and toxic culture of racial aggressions, bullying and marginalization against Black employees.

title: Meet This Popular Essential Worker. And Give Her a Scratch Behind the Ear.
description: In early March, Everett Grays transplanted heart began to fail. A couple months shy of the five-year anniversary of receiving his miracle heart, the 8-year-old was admitted to the cardiac I.C.U. at the Childrens Healthcare of Atlanta at Egleston, as his immune system battled with the heart that saved his life as a toddler.

title: Friezes London Fairs Are Art Worlds Latest Cancellations
description: This Octobers Frieze London and Frieze Masters art fairs, the double-headed centerpiece of the British capitals busiest art market week, have been canceled in light of continued unprecedented challenges regarding Covid-19 (coronavirus), the organizers said Tuesday.

title: Grappling With How to Reopen Schools Safely
description: To the Editor:

title: California Man Is Accused of Driving Into a Group of Black People
description: A man who the authorities say drove into a group of Black people at a Southern California hotel, injuring one person, has been accused of a hate crime, prosecutors said on Monday.

title: Hero Pay Raises Disappear for Many Essential Workers
description: Many retailers across the United States have quietly stopped providing their workers with the pay raises they had dispensed at the start of the pandemic, despite surging virus numbers in many states.

title: What to Keep in Mind on Election Day: Times Reporters on the 2020 Homestretch
Republicans Said to Be Planning to Move Some Convention Events Outdoors
description: With coronavirus cases surging in Florida, Republicans are planning to move the three nights of their national convention from an indoor arena to an outdoor venue in Jacksonville, but its still unclear how many people will be allowed to attend the events, people familiar with the discussions said Tuesday.

title: How Facebook Handles Climate Disinformation
description: As Covid-19 spread across the globe early this year, Facebook went into action to combat potentially dangerous disinformation on its site. The company labeled and suppressed misleading content, removed disinformation and directed users to reputable sources, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention website.

title: Youd Rather Get a Coronavirus Vaccine Through Your Nose
description: Of the 150-plus coronavirus vaccines in development around the world, the lions share will rely on a needle prick to make their way into the body.

title: These Are the Most Critical Investments, Biden Says of Climate Plan
description: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. unveiled his $2 trillion climate plan for reducing fossil fuel use across the U.S. and creating jobs.

title: Delle Donnes Opt-Out Request Is Denied
description: Elena Delle Donne, the W.N.B.A.s reigning most valuable player, said she had been denied a medical waiver for the leagues abbreviated season, which begins July 25.

title: Three Marines, Now Focus of Russian Bounties Investigation, Show the Costs of an Endless War
description: The American military convoy was almost back to Bagram Air Base in Afghanistan when a vehicle, laden with explosives, careened into it and detonated.

title: Billboard Tweaks, but Doesnt Repeal, a Chart Rule Over Album Bundles
description: This spring, the country singer Kenny Chesney narrowly beat the typically chart-dominating rapper Drake to a Billboard No. 1 debut using a marketing tactic that has been increasingly common in recent years  the ticket bundle, which includes an artists new album as a redeemable bonus when fans pony up to see them in concert.

title: Judge, Expressing Skepticism, Upends $25 Million Harvey Weinstein Settlement
description: Expressing deep skepticism, a federal judge on Tuesday upended a $25 million proposed civil settlement between Harvey Weinstein, his former film company, and dozens of women who have accused him of sexual harassment and abuse.

title: Aide Posts Cartoon Mocking Fauci as White House Denies Undermining Him
description: WASHINGTON  White House officials this week have denied trying to undermine Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the governments top infectious disease expert, for his stark analysis of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: How to Fight Health Cures Online
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Seeing Native Americans Nowhere, and Everywhere
description: On Monday, the N.F.L. team in Washington announced that it would be retiring the name Redskins and its feather-topped Indian head logo, abruptly reversing its staunch defense of a name long considered as a racial slur.

title: Dateline-Saigon Review: Challenging the Official Story
description: The documentary Dateline-Saigon reconstructs the early rumblings of the Vietnam War  mainly from 1961 through 1964  through the eyes of five print reporters who were on assignment in Saigon.

title: Thereza de Orlans e Bragana, Brazilian Society Doyenne, Dies at 91
description: Thereza de Orlans e Bragana, an elegant society figure in Rio de Janeiro who gained a measure of international celebrity in the 1950s and 60s before transforming herself into a princess by marrying into Brazils royal family, died on June 27 in Rio. She was 91.

title: Former V.A. Nursing Assistant Pleads Guilty in Deaths of 7 Patients
description: A former nursing assistant at a Department of Veterans Affairs hospital in West Virginia pleaded guilty on Tuesday to second-degree murder in the deaths of seven patients.

title: The Flu May Linger in the Air, Just Like the Coronavirus
description: The coronavirus is not the flu. But the two viruses have something crucial in common: Both have been described as spreading primarily through close contact with symptomatic people or the surfaces theyve touched.

title: Baby Was Infected With Coronavirus in Womb, Study Reports
description: Researchers on Tuesday reported strong evidence that the coronavirus can be transmitted from a pregnant woman to a fetus.

title: Why Alabamas Senate Race Is the Most Negative in the Country
description: One candidate is weak, an embarrassment, a Washington insider and not man enough.

title: Andrew Cuomo Ascends to the Mountaintop With His Pandemic Poster
description: Mao Zedong wrote poetry. Bill Clinton played saxophone. Winston Churchill and George W. Bush both turned to painting. For some politicians, only art can calm the passions after a long day  and Gov. Andrew Cuomo, now steering New York to a cautious reopening after the deaths of 32,000 citizens, has lately taken solace in the discipline of graphic design.

title: Make Your Own Printers Hat
description: The pressmans hat, also known as the printers hat, was designed to protect its wearer from ink and grease splatters on the job  all of that 19th-century machinery could get messy  and was still commonly used until the 1990s.

title: The Specter of Caste in Silicon Valley
description: On June 30, Californias Department of Fair Employment and Housing regulators sued Cisco Systems Inc., for discrimination. The cause was not, like most workplace discrimination lawsuits, based on race, gender, age or sexual orientation. It was based on caste.

title: Turkeys Islamist Dream Finally Becomes a Reality
description: IZMIR, Turkey  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey on Friday issued a decree ordering the Hagia Sophia, a majestic 65,000-square-foot stone structure from the sixth century in Istanbul, to be opened for Muslim prayers. The same day, a top Turkish court had revoked the 1934 decree by Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the founder of the Turkish republic, which had turned it into a museum.

title: Tiny Love Stories: We Gave Up, but Her Hair Didnt
description: The driving rain hit her train window and streamed two rows back across mine. The depth of her grief was impossible to contain within six feet of social distance. It spilled over. Too on edge to listen to music, I overheard her story unfold through phone calls as we crossed Connecticut: Early that morning, heart attack, her father wont walk her down the aisle. I bore silent, masked witness to the heaviest moment of her life. On Amtrak 2167, I absorbed an ounce of her pain. Now, I will carry it for her, a strangers burden in a strange world.  Hannah Sands

title: The Sex Talk Is Actually a Series of Talks
description: Like many parents, I had hoped to delay discussing sex with my young sons as long as possible. They would ask me where babies came from on some vague day in the future, I imagined, when they were mature and I had a knowledgeable, profound answer at the ready.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell Is Denied Bail by Judge Who Calls Her a Flight Risk
description: Ghislaine Maxwell, the longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein who has been charged with helping him recruit, groom and ultimately sexually abuse girls as young as 14, was denied bail on Tuesday by a judge who said she posed a high risk of fleeing before her trial.

title: From Rep. Carolyn Maloney: Please Fill Out the Census
description: To the Editor:

title: Banks Stockpile Billions as They Prepare for Things to Get Worse
description: Three of the nations biggest banks revealed Tuesday that they had set aside billions of dollars to cover potential losses on loans, signaling that they dont expect consumers and corporations to be able to pay their debts in the coming months as the pandemic continues to gut employment and commerce.

title: Tom Bergeron Is Out as Dancing With the Stars Host After 15 Years
description: After spending nearly a quarter of his life as the host of Dancing With the Stars, Tom Bergeron, the 65-year-old host of the one-time ABC ratings juggernaut, has been dropped from the show, he announced on Twitter on Monday evening.

title: Bari Weiss Resigns From New York Times Opinion Post
description: Bari Weiss, a writer and editor for the opinion department of The New York Times, has resigned from the paper, citing bullying by colleagues and an illiberal environment.

title: A Media Critic Focuses on the Crisis in Local News
description: Before she became a media columnist, Margaret Sullivan saw the crisis in the American newspaper industry from within.

title: Strains Show in Russias Make-Believe Politics
description: MOSCOW  Vladimir V. Zhirinovsky, Russias septuagenarian nationalist firebrand, long functioned as a safety valve for public discontent, corralling protest votes but then supporting President Vladimir V. Putin at key junctures.

title: Ireland Has a New Coronavirus Fear: Americans Who Flout Quarantine
description: Janet Cavanagh, whose electric bike tour company offers a guided glimpse of western Irelands windswept landscape, saw her business come to a swift halt  along with nearly everything else  as the coronavirus pandemic forced the country into lockdown.

title: Radio Host Loses Her Show Over English-Only Rant
description: A New Hampshire radio station has severed ties with a conservative radio host who berated landscape workers for speaking Spanish in a widely shared video.

title: U.S. Rescinds Plan to Strip Visas From International Students in Online Classes
description: In a rare and swift immigration policy reversal, the Trump administration on Tuesday bowed to snowballing opposition from universities, Silicon Valley and 20 states and abandoned a plan to strip international college students of their visas if they did not attend at least some classes in person.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $3.5 MILLION

title: For a New Series, Black Artists in Dance Tell Their Stories
description: In the absence of live dance performances, interviews with artists in the field, presented online, have become a way to stay connected until its safe to gather again. A new series in that spirit, Black Dance Stories, favors storytelling over interviewing, while giving artists a chance to meet and chat the way they might have in a theater lobby.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New Data Shows an Extraordinary Rise in U.S. Coastal Flooding
description: WASHINGTON  Parts of the United States saw record levels of high-tide flooding last year as rising seas brought water further into coastal homes and infrastructure, government scientists reported Tuesday.

title: German Court Says Tesla Self-Driving Claims Are Misleading
description: Teslas plans to steal buyers from German luxury automakers suffered a setback Tuesday after a court in Munich ruled that the California maker of electric cars made exaggerated promises about its autonomous driving technology.

title: Telluride Film Festival Cancels 2020 Edition Due to the Pandemic
description: After months of vowing to persevere despite the pandemic, the Telluride Film Festival capitulated Tuesday, announcing the cancellation of this years event, scheduled for Sept. 3-7 in the tony Colorado enclave.

title: Live Primary Election Results: Races in Alabama, Maine and Texas
description: Get the latest primary results from Alabama, Maine and Texas.

title: Maine, Texas and Alabama Election Results: Live Updates and Analysis
description: Follow live coverage and analysis from Times reporters.

description: Detailed results and maps from the Alabama primary runoff election.

description: Detailed results and maps from the Maine primary election.

description: Detailed results and maps from the Texas primary runoff election.

title: Global Methane Emissions Reach a Record High
description: Global emissions of methane, a potent greenhouse gas, soared to a record high in 2017, the most recent year for which worldwide data are available, researchers said Tuesday.

title: University of Texas Wont Drop Song With Racist History
description: The University of Texas at Austin said it would rename a building named for a racist professor, erect a statue of the schools first Black football player and commission a monument to its first Black undergraduates. Whats not changing? The Eyes of Texas, a campus anthem with minstrel roots that student-athletes want abolished.

title: Egyptian Dissident Battles Extradition in Spanish Court
description: MADRID  An Egyptian dissident whose online videos ignited a flurry of rare antigovernment protests last year is fighting against extradition from Spain, as President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt campaigns to silence his most vocal critics abroad.

title: Tiger Woods Returns, Without Roars
description: DUBLIN, Ohio  Tuesday morning, in his first appearance at a PGA Tour event in five months, Tiger Woods hit a majestic iron shot during a practice round that soared toward an elevated green 250 yards away. When the ball deftly skirted bunkers protecting the putting surface and settled eight feet from the 15th hole, one person among the handful of security officers, volunteers and media members watching Woods clapped his hands.

title: Mondaire Jones Rides Insurgent Wave to a House Primary Win in N.Y.
description: Mondaire Jones, a progressive candidate supported by the institutional left, was declared the victor in a crowded Democratic House primary in the suburbs north of New York City, all but ensuring that he will join Congress next year as among its first openly gay African-American members.

title: Jay Riffe, Spearfishing King, Is Dead at 82
description: Jay Riffe recalled his first spearfishing outing as a fearsome affair  not for the fish but for him. Mr. Riffe, a celebrated California speargun designer, entrepreneur and pioneer of tankless hunting and diving, was about 10 years old, stalking lobster and sea bass in 70-degree Pacific waters while wearing a sweatshirt, gardening gloves and boxer trunks.

title: Dunford Bows Out of Search for Virus Oversight Chair, Leaving it Leaderless
description: WASHINGTON  General Joseph F. Dunford Jr., the top choice of congressional leaders to chair a bipartisan coronavirus oversight commission, has taken himself out of the running for the post, the latest setback in Congresss efforts to keep tabs on the distribution of hundreds of billions of dollars of federal pandemic aid.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Polands Presidential Election Was Close but Voters Remain Far Apart
description: WARSAW  President Andrzej Duda narrowly won re-election this week, using the same playbook that brought his Law and Justice party to power five years ago: stoking fear and blaming an enemy.

title: What Its Been Like to Vote in 2020 So Far
description: Over the past five months, people have waited in all sorts of lines to vote: some bent around stuccoed store corners, some curving through city parks, others spaced six feet apart.

title: The Roberts Court Is Nothing Like America
description: As the Supreme Court ends its term and a momentous presidential election looms ahead, the contrast between the Roberts court and the country could hardly be starker.

title: Should We Even Care About Trumps Taxes?
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: The Trump administration, in a little-noticed document posted this week, has ordered hospitals to bypass the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and, beginning tomorrow, send all coronavirus patient information to a central database in Washington.

title: Live Alabama Senate Runoff Results: Sessions vs. Tuberville
description: See full results and maps from the Alabama primary runoff.

title: Im the President of M.I.T. America Needs Foreign Students.
description: Confronted with a deadly virus, many American colleges and universities are choosing to protect their communities by teaching fall classes largely or entirely online. Last week, the federal government deliberately disrupted those plans by proposing a new rule that would have prevented potentially hundreds of thousands of foreign students from studying in the United States this fall if their classes were taught remotely.

title: Mans Dismembered Body Is Found in Luxury Manhattan Condo
description: [Breaking News: Suspect arrested in murder of Fahim Saleh.]

title: Who Bears Witness to a Hidden Epidemic?
description: Within the first few weeks of states going into lockdown, reports began flooding in from domestic violence hotline centers throughout the country: They were seeing spikes in calls. But as sheltering-in-place dragged on, the calls for help dropped off. To those familiar with the dynamics of intimate-partner violence, this was not a good thing.

title: How a Velvet Ant (Which Is a Wasp) Got Its White Fluff
description: At the foot of certain shrubs in the Mojave Desert, fluffy white motes skitter like tumbleweeds across the sand. Some are fruit: harmless, fuzzy orbs dropped by the creosote bush. Others are white wasps  not that kind  of the species Dasymutilla gloriosa, which have painful stingers and luxuriously silky hair, or setae.

title: Scientists Have Finally Calculated How Many Hot Dogs a Person Can Eat at Once
description: Over the Fourth of July weekend, with streams of sweat pouring down his face, Joey Chestnut broke his own world record for hot dog eating, by downing 75 hot dogs (with buns) in 10 minutes at the Nathans Famous Hot Dog Eating Contest. It was his 13th win at the annual contest. And Miki Sudo set a womens record, 48.5 hot dogs, to grab her seventh straight Nathans win.

title: Alabamas Mud-Slinging Senate Primary
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Nick Corasaniti, your host on Tuesdays for our coverage of all things media and messaging.

title: Blaine Kern, Architect of Lavish Mardi Gras Floats, Dies at 93
description: Blaine Kern, who helped turn Mardi Gras in New Orleans into a huge event known around the world, most notably through the innovative and spectacular parade floats he designed and built, died on June 25 at his home in the city. He was 93.

title: Naya Riveras Death Ruled Accidental Drowning
description: The actress Naya Rivera died in an accidental drowning, the Ventura County Medical Examiners Office said Tuesday, a day after her body was found in the California lake where she had disappeared.

title: Congress, Do Your Job: Help Americans Without One
description: Unemployment benefits provide people who lose jobs with a little help for a little while. The money is not really enough to live on, by design: People are supposed to find a new job.

title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg Is Released From Hospital
description: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was released from the Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore on Wednesday, a day after she was admitted there for a possible infection, a Supreme Court spokeswoman said.

title: Trump Administration Strips C.D.C. of Control of Coronavirus Data
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration has ordered hospitals to bypass the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and send all Covid-19 patient information to a central database in Washington beginning on Wednesday. The move has alarmed health experts who fear the data will be politicized or withheld from the public.

title: Asked About Black Americans Killed by Police, Trump Says, So Are White People
description: President Trump, whose re-election prospects have dimmed as Americans question his handling of the coronavirus outbreak and race relations, on Tuesday stoked racial grievances yet again with a series of startling remarks about the Confederate flag, victims of police violence and a St. Louis couple who pointed guns at protesters peacefully marching by their house.

title: World Population Could Peak Decades Ahead of U.N. Forecast, Study Asserts
description: United Nations demographers have been anticipating since last year that the worlds population may stop growing by 2100 as fertility rates decline, projecting a peak of 10.9 billion people by centurys end, compared with roughly 7.8 billion now.

title: 2 Stylists Had Coronavirus, but Wore Masks. 139 Clients Didnt Fall Sick.
description: Vigilant mask wearing might have spared nearly 140 people from catching the coronavirus at a hair salon in Missouri, according to a report published on Tuesday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. In May, the people interacted with two hair stylists with confirmed coronavirus infections, but none ended up showing symptoms of Covid-19.

title: Coronavirus Cases in U.S. Are Unequivocally Rising, Fauci Says
description: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci said at a digital event at Georgetown University on Tuesday that there was no doubt of more infections.

title: Corrections: July 15, 2020
description: An article on Saturday about the reluctance of public health experts to speak about the dangers of attending protests during a pandemic when the protests are against racism misstated the difference in life expectancy between Black Americans and white Americans. It is a difference of three and a half years, not two years.

title: New York Times Will Move Part of Hong Kong Office to Seoul
description: This article has been updated to include new details on The Timess visa troubles in Hong Kong as well as comments from the Chinese Foreign Ministry.

title: The White House Called a News Conference. Trump Turned It Into a Meandering Monologue.
description: WASHINGTON  In theory, President Trump summoned television cameras to the heat-baked Rose Garden early Tuesday evening to announce new measures against China to punish it for its oppression of Hong Kong. But that did not last long.

title: Most Big School Districts Arent Ready to Reopen. Heres Why.
description: As education leaders decide whether to reopen classrooms in the fall amid a raging pandemic, many are looking to a standard generally agreed upon among epidemiologists: To control community spread of the coronavirus, the average daily infection rate among those who are tested should not exceed 5 percent.

title: First Coronavirus Vaccine Tested in Humans Shows Early Promise
description: An experimental coronavirus vaccine made by the biotech company Moderna provoked a promising immune response against the virus and appeared safe in the first 45 people who received it, researchers reported on Tuesday in The New England Journal of Medicine.

title: For Sessions, No Amount of Campaigning Could Overcome Trump in Alabama
description: MOBILE, Ala.  Jeff Sessions spent his final days on the campaign trail reiterating his support for President Trumps agenda, reminding voters of his efforts to curb illegal immigration while attorney general and emphasizing how, as a senator, he had endorsed Mr. Trumps presidential campaign at a time when few others in Washington would.

title: Sessions Pays the Price for Incurring Trumps Wrath, Losing Alabama Senate Race
description: MOBILE, Ala.  As a longtime senator from Alabama, Jeff Sessions did nothing less than legitimize Donald. J. Trump as a credible Republican candidate for president, endorsing him when no other big names did and championing him to conservative voters. As Mr. Trumps star rose, Mr. Sessionss rose, too.

title: Who Helps Out in a Crisis?
description: Kathleen Tierney, a co-author of Disasters, Collective Behavior, and Social Organization

title: Sara Gideon Wins Nomination to Challenge Susan Collins in Maine
description: WASHINGTON  Sara Gideon, the speaker of the Maine House of Representatives, on Tuesday formally became the Democratic nominee to challenge Senator Susan Collins of Maine, wielding a formidable war chest in a race that could determine whether Republicans retain control of the Senate in November.

title: N.Y.P.D. Says It Used Restraint During Protests. Heres What the Videos Show.
description: Police officials say there were isolated cases of inappropriate force. But 64 videos show many attacks on protesters that appear unwarranted.

title: Quotation of the Day: Welcome to the Happiest Place on Earth. Covid Testing Nightly.
description: This is going to be a very unique opportunity to observe the human condition.

title: Obies Honor A Strange Loop and Heroes of the Fourth Turning
description: A Strange Loop, Michael R. Jackson's meta-musical about race, sexuality and musical theater, and Heroes of the Fourth Turning, Will Arberys play about faith and politics in a corner of the conservative Catholic world, were the most-honored shows Tuesday night at the annual Obie Awards.

title: Kansas Congressman Is Charged With Voter Fraud
description: Representative Steve Watkins, Republican of Kansas, was charged with three felonies related to voter fraud on Tuesday, shortly before a televised debate in which he dismissed the accusations involving a municipal election as a political move.

title: Ronny Jackson, Ex-White House Doctor, Wins Texas House Runoff
description: Dr. Ronny L.
